intro: Calyptranthes salamensis, commonly known as the Salam Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Salam in the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink to red in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
